skills.name: Identify unit fractions when part of a shape

explanations.A: This circle is split into 4 equal parts. We are looking for the shape that is not divided into equal parts...
explanations.B: You can use diagonal lines to split shapes! This triangle is split into 4 equal parts. We are looking for the shape that is not divided into equal parts...
explanations.C: You can split a shape into any number of parts! This rectangle is split into 3 equal parts. We are looking for the shape that is not divided into equal parts...
explanations.D: This square is split into 3 parts but they are not equal in size therefore this is the correct answer!

explanations.A: You can split a shape into any number of parts! This rectangle is split into 3 equal parts. We are looking for the shape that is not divided into equal parts...
explanations.B: This rectangle is split into 6 parts but they are not all equal in size therefore this is the correct answer!
explanations.C: You can use diagonal lines to split shapes! This rectangle is split into 4 equal parts. We are looking for the shape that is not divided into equal parts...
explanations.D: This circle is split into 8 equal parts. We are looking for the shape that is not divided into equal parts...

explanations.A: This circle has been split into 8 equal parts. 1 รท 8 = 1/8 therefore the value of each part is one eighth.
explanations.B: This shape has 8 sides but it's not been split into any parts. Look for the shape that has been split into 8 equal pieces...
explanations.C: This shape is split into 8 parts but the size of each part is not equal therefore each part is not an eighth. Which of the shapes given is split into 8 equal parts?
explanations.D: This square has been split into 4 unequal parts therefore each part is not worth one eighth. Look for the shape that has been split into 8 equal parts...

explanations.A: This hexagon has been split into 6 unequal parts therefore each part is not worth one sixth. Look for the shape that has been split into 6 equal parts...
explanations.B: This rectangle has been split into 6 unequal parts therefore each part is not worth one sixth. Look for the shape that has been split into 6 equal parts...
explanations.C: This circle has been split into 6 equal parts. 1 รท 6 = 1/6 therefore the value of each part is one sixth.
explanations.D: This shape has 6 sides but it's not been split into any parts. Look for the shape that has been split into 6 equal pieces...

explanations.A: One of the two parts has been shaded but as the parts aren't equal this does not represent 1/2 of the circle. Look for the shape that has been split into two equal parts and has one of the parts shaded!
explanations.B: This triangle has been split into two equal parts and then one of the two parts has been shaded. As the parts are equal 1/2 of the triangle is shaded!
explanations.C: 1/3 of this rectangle has been shaded, not 1/2... Look for the shape that has been split into two equal parts and has one of the parts shaded!
explanations.D: One of the two parts has been shaded but as the parts aren't equal this does not represent 1/2 of the square. Look for the shape that has been split into two equal parts and has one of the parts shaded!

explanations.A: One of the two parts has been shaded but as the parts aren't equal in size this does not represent 1/2 of the shape. Look for the shape that has been split into two equal parts and has one of the parts shaded!
explanations.B: This hexagon has been split into two equal parts and then one of the two parts has been shaded. As the parts are equal 1/2 of the shape is shaded!
explanations.C: One of the two parts has been shaded but as the parts aren't equal this does not represent 1/2 of the rectangle. Look for the shape that has been split into two equal parts and has one of the parts shaded!
explanations.D: 1/3 of this triangle has been shaded, not 1/2... Look for the shape that has been split into two equal parts and has one of the parts shaded!

explanations.A: The rectangle has been split into 5 equal parts and one of the parts is shaded therefore 1/5 of the shape is shaded.
explanations.B: I think you have done number of shaded parts / number of unshaded parts to get 1/4 but you need to do number of shaded parts / total number of parts...
explanations.C: This is the fraction of the shape that is unshaded! The question wants to know the fraction of shaded...
explanations.D: You can tell! How many equal parts has the rectangle been split into? And, how many of these parts are shaded?

explanations.A: The rectangle has been split into 6 equal parts and one of the parts is shaded therefore 1/6 of the shape is shaded.
explanations.B: I think you have done number of shaded parts / number of unshaded parts to get 1/5 but you need to do number of shaded parts / total number of parts...
explanations.C: The shaded part is the fourth one along, but the position doesn't affect the fraction that is shaded. We want the fraction of shaded parts out of total parts.
explanations.D: You can tell! How many equal parts has the rectangle been split into? And, how many of these parts are shaded?

explanations.A: If we added a line to this shape, the parts would not be equal - the middle pieces would be larger than the pieces at the edge. Look for the shape where every part would be equal in size, after you added the line...
explanations.B: If we added a line to this shape, the parts would not be equal - the pieces at the top would be smaller than the pieces at the bottom. Look for the shape where every part would be equal in size, after you added the line...
explanations.C: If we add a horizontal line across the middle part, there will be 6 even parts!
explanations.D: I think you are imagining a line down the middle but this would make two triangular parts and two trapezoidal parts so they wouldn't be equal. Look for the shape where every part would be equal in size, after you added the line...

explanations.A: If we added a line across this shape, the parts would not be equal - the middle pieces would be larger than the pieces at the edge. Look for the shape where every part would be equal in size, after you added the line...
explanations.B: If we added a line to this shape, the parts would not be equal. Look for the shape where every part would be equal in size, after you added the line...
explanations.C: If we add one more line to split the centre and the bottom left into two triangles, there would be 4 equal triangular parts inside the shape.
explanations.D: We would need two lines to split this shape into 8 equal parts - one across the middle and one from the centre to the bottom. Look for the shape where every part would be equal in size, after you added the line...
